intro: Chytroma jarana, commonly known as the Jarana chytroma, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red in color. Chytroma jarana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
